variant.question: (For this question use the image in the annex). Which of these statements about the pitching moment coefficient versus angle of attack lines in the annex is correct?

options.text: In its curved part at high angles of attack line 2 illustrates increasing static longitudinal stability.
Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 3 when compared with line 4 at low and moderate angles of attack.
The horizontal part of line 2 illustrates static longitudinal instability.
The CG position is further aft at line 4 when compared with line 1.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 081-27.
Which of these statements about the pitching moment coefficient versus angle of attack lines in the annex is correct?

options.text: Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 4 when compared with line 3 at low and moderate angles of attack.
Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 3 compared with line 4 at low and moderate angles of attack.
The CG position is further forward at line 1 when compared with line 4.
In its curved part line 2 illustrates a decreasing static longitudinal stability at high angles of attack.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 081-27.
Which of these statements about the pitching moment coefficient versus angle of attack lines in the annex is correct?

options.text: The CG position is further forward at line 4 when compared with line 1.
Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 3 when compared with line 4 at low and moderate angles of attack.
In its curved part line 2 illustrates a decreasing static longitudinal stability at high angles of attack.
The CG position is further aft at line 4 when compared with line 1.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 081-27.
Which of these statements about the pitching moment coefficient versus angle of attack lines in the annex is correct?

options.text: The CG position is further aft at line 1 when compared with line 4.
The CG position is further forward at line 1 when compared with line 4.
Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 3 when compared with line 4 at low and moderate angles of attack.
In its curved part at high angles of attack line 2 illustrates a decreasing static longitudinal stability.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 081-27.
Which of these statements about the pitching moment coefficient versus angle of attack lines in the annex is correct?

options.text: In its curved part at high angles of attack line 2 illustrates increasing static longitudinal stability.
The CG position is further aft at line 4 when compared with line 1.
The horizontal part of line 2 illustrates static longitudinal instability.
Static longitudinal stability is greater at line 3 when compared with line 4 at low and moderate angles of attack.

variant.question: Low speed pitch-up can be caused by a significant thrust:

options.text: increase with podded engines located beneath a low-mounted wing.
increase with engines located on the rear fuselage.
decrease with engines located on the rear fuselage.
decrease with podded engines located beneath a low-mounted wing.

variant.question: Fairings of tail mounted engines give ___ pitching moment.

options.text: positive
negative or zero
zero
negative
